page.title: 05Listed Buildings Page 1
page.content: THE CHURCH: dedicated to St Cuthberga, St Mary and All Saints. The main church dates back to 1832 rebuilt after a fire, only the tower is Saxon. ABBEY FARMHOUSE: 1777, the last working farmhouse in the village it ceased operation Michaelmas 1984 by the tennant and taken in hand by Crichel Estates. (Grade II) ABBEY HOUSE: house and garden wall to South and West are listed*. Formerly called Manor House it dates from 1510. Built by Sir Richard Arundel, his crest, a horse with oak tree, can still be seen on the West wall of the house. (*Grade II) ABBEY BUILDINGS: wrongly named, it actually was part of the old Edward I Manor House from where Sir Richard left to fight for Henry V at the battle of Agincourt 1415.
